::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

Akatsuki Blitzkampf is a 2D fighting game doujinshi Japanese, developed by SUBTLE STYLE for Microsoft Windows. Released on 30 April 2007, the game is a sequel to Akatsuki Shisei Ichigo. The title has a lot of attention in Japan and elsewhere for its high resolution sprites and gameplay older style.

Akatsuki Blitzkampf (or Denko Senki Japanese) is set in a fictional future involving various characters that resemble more or less the German soldiers during the Second World War, among others. In addition visual play this kind of specific topic and militaristic environment, portrayed by the plan and a little cubist portraits of characters and images of the story sequence.

In terms of Blitzkampf game style, is regarded as relatively "old school" compared to many other doujins fighting releases like Melty Blood, Eternal Fighter Zero, or Big Bang Beat, as many of the systems and conventions in the game are quite similar the various end of fighting games 90s created by Capcom. For example, many players allude to the defense system, which resembles the one of Street Fighter III installments. The free amount of playing extra modes provides (such as Survival, Time Attack, or Sugoroku) and the ways they are unlocked is largely reminiscent of a release of an arcade fighting game console, further reinforcing the feeling semi -retro. In other words, the game's focus is on the control of space and play careful legs rather than flashy combos and intense aerial combat.
